subject: Basic Doubt
msgSnippet: I have a class Manager.java that s to be unit tested. In the TestManager class public class TestManager extends TestCase{ Manager mgr = null; public
messageBody:
I have a class Manager.java that's to be unit tested.

In the TestManager class

public class TestManager extends TestCase{

Manager mgr = null;

public TestManager(String name){
super(name);
}

public static Test suite(){
return (new TestSuite(TestManager.class));
}
public void setUp(){
super.setUp();
mgr = new Manager();
testAdd();
}

public void testAdd(){
int expected = 2;
assertEquals((1+1),2);
}

public void tearDown(){
super.tearDown();
}

}

Why is the Manager object required to be instantiated inside the
setUp method? Is it required to have a test suite method?
